SPY’s five-day net inflows totaled $5 billion, showing that investors put capital into SPY over the past five trading days.', 'Meanwhile, its three-month average trading volume is 81.37 million shares.', 'It must be noted that the retail sentiment for the SPY ETF is positive, while hedge fund managers have decreased their holdings of the ETF in the last quarter.', 'SPY’s Price Forecast

Meanwhile, its five holdings with the greatest downside potential are:

Revealingly, SPY’s ETF Smart Score is a seven, implying that this ETF is likely to perform in line with the broader market over the long term.', 'Power up your ETF investing with TipRanks.', 'Discover the Best AI ETFs, with High Upside Potential, carefully curated based on TipRanks’ analysis.', 'Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']

title: ‘It’s Cheaper Than Almost Ever,’ Says Top Analyst About Nvidia Stock
article:
['Nvidia (NVDA) is still growing, but its stock price has stalled.', 'Top Bernstein analyst Stacy Rasgon said that mismatch has pushed the stock to levels that now look unusually cheap.', 'The 5-star analyst kept his Outperform rating and a $275 price target, and said clearly: “We would be buyers here.”

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Rasgon explained that while Nvidia shares are up about 30% this year, the stock has stalled since July as other chip stocks kept rising.', 'With earnings forecasts still moving higher, that pause has pushed Nvidia’s valuation down to just under 25 times forward earnings, after a 27% multiple drop this year.', 'The analyst said that number matters because Nvidia rarely trades at these levels.', 'Based on the last ten years, the stock has almost never traded this cheap.', 'In fact, today’s valuation puts Nvidia in the bottom 11% of its historical range.', 'The comparison looks even more striking against other chip stocks.', 'Nvidia now trades at about a 13% discount to the semiconductor index.', 'Rasgon noted that over the last decade, there have been only 13 days when Nvidia traded cheaper than this relative to the broader chip sector.', 'So why has the stock lagged?', 'Rasgon said investors are worried about a slowdown in AI spending, long-term capital plans, and rising competition from custom chips.', 'He believes these concerns are being overstated.', 'He said current spending plans still look solid, and demand for Nvidia’s GPUs remains healthy.', 'At the same time, Nvidia’s next-generation platform, Rubin, is moving closer, with upcoming events such as CES and GTC likely to refocus attention on the product roadmap.', 'Rasgon also pointed to possible upside if H200 sales to China receive approval.', 'Looking ahead, Rasgon added that expectations still appear low when compared with Nvidia’s long-term Blackwell and Rubin opportunity, which management has said could exceed $500 billion.', 'Overall, the analyst believes Nvidia’s strong business and reset valuation make the stock attractive at current levels.', 'Is Nvidia a Buy Now, According to Wall Street?', 'Wall Street feels much the same way about Nvidia.', 'With 40 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell, NVDA enjoys a Strong Buy consensus rating.', 'Nvidia’s 12-month average price target of $259.23 implies almost 48.87% upside potential.', 'See more NVDA analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences:
Nvidia (NVDA) is still growing, but its stock price has stalled. The 5-star analyst kept his Outperform rating and a $275 price target, and said clearly: “We would be buyers here.”

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Rasgon explained that while Nvidia shares are up about 30% this year, the stock has stalled since July as other chip stocks kept rising. With earnings forecasts still moving higher, that pause has pushed Nvidia’s valuation down to just under 25 times forward earnings, after a 27% multiple drop this year. The analyst said that number matters because Nvidia rarely trades at these levels. In fact, today’s valuation puts Nvidia in the bottom 11% of its historical range. Nvidia now trades at about a 13% discount to the semiconductor index. Rasgon noted that over the last decade, there have been only 13 days when Nvidia traded cheaper than this relative to the broader chip sector. He said current spending plans still look solid, and demand for Nvidia’s GPUs remains healthy. At the same time, Nvidia’s next-generation platform, Rubin, is moving closer, with upcoming events such as CES and GTC likely to refocus attention on the product roadmap. Looking ahead, Rasgon added that expectations still appear low when compared with Nvidia’s long-term Blackwell and Rubin opportunity, which management has said could exceed $500 billion. Overall, the analyst believes Nvidia’s strong business and reset valuation make the stock attractive at current levels. Is Nvidia a Buy Now, According to Wall Street? Wall Street feels much the same way about Nvidia. Nvidia’s 12-month average price target of $259.23 implies almost 48.87% upside potential.

title: Tencent Has Found a Way to Access Nvidia’s (NVDA) Advanced AI Chips through Japan
article:
['Tencent Holdings (TCEHY), the Chinese company behind WeChat, has found a way to access Nvidia’s (NVDA) most advanced AI chips, even though U.S. rules are meant to stop Chinese firms from using them.', 'According to a source who spoke with Barron’s, Tencent is working through a Japanese cloud service provider, Datasection (JP:3905), which recently agreed to buy Nvidia’s powerful Blackwell chips for data centers in Japan and Australia.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Because Tencent doesn’t own the chips directly and instead rents access via the cloud, this setup technically avoids U.S. export restrictions.', 'Unsurprisingly, though, this workaround has raised concerns in Washington, with lawmakers warning that it exposes a major loophole in U.S. rules designed to protect America’s lead in AI.', 'The deal also contradicts recent assurances from President Donald Trump, who claimed the Blackwell and Rubin chip generations would remain out of China’s hands.', 'In addition, the financial side of the deal is just as complicated.', 'Datasection struggled to get Japanese banks to fund the project due to worries about Tencent’s involvement.', 'Instead, it secured funding through warrants from Singapore-based First Plus Financial, which became a major shareholder in 2024.', 'Despite the controversy, Datasection continues to expand, with plans to build more data centers.', 'What Is a Good Price for NVDA?', 'Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Strong Buy consensus rating on NVDA stock based on 40 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below.', 'Furthermore, the average NVDA price target of $260 per share implies 43.7% upside potential.', 'See more NVDA analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences: Tencent Holdings (TCEHY), the Chinese company behind WeChat, has found a way to access Nvidia’s (NVDA) most advanced AI chips, even though U.S. rules are meant to stop Chinese firms from using them. According to a source who spoke with Barron’s, Tencent is working through a Japanese cloud service provider, Datasection (JP:3905), which recently agreed to buy Nvidia’s powerful Blackwell chips for data centers in Japan and Australia. Despite the controversy, Datasection continues to expand, with plans to build more data centers.

title: AI Chipmaker Cerebras Systems Files to Hold U.S. IPO
article:
['Artificial intelligence (AI) microchip maker Cerebras Systems has filed to hold an initial public offering (IPO) in the U.S.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

The company, which develops high-performance processors for AI workloads, is planning to hold its IPO as soon as the second quarter of 2026.', 'Cerebras previously withdrew its IPO filing in October of this year, days after announcing it had raised over $1 billion in a funding round that valued the chipmaker at $8 billion.', 'The company first filed paperwork with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to go public in 2024, before postponing and ultimately withdrawing its IPO this autumn.', 'There has been speculation that the IPO had been withdrawn over U.S. national security concerns about a minority investment in Cerebras by a technology company based in the United Arab Emirates (UAE).', 'Competitors of Cerebras

Cerebras Systems recently announced that it has obtained clearance from the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) to hold its IPO.', 'Based in Sunnyvale, California, Cerebras is known for its wafer-scale engines and microchips designed to accelerate the training of large-language AI models.', 'Cerebras Systems’ main competitors are fellow chipmakers Nvidia (NVDA) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), among other chipmakers.', 'It is not yet clear which U.S. exchange Cerebras plans to list shares on or what its ticker symbol will be.', 'An exact date for the IPO also hasn’t been announced.', 'Is NVDA Stock a Buy?', 'The stock of Nvidia has a consensus Strong Buy rating among 42 Wall Street analysts.', 'That rating is based on 40 Buy, one Hold, and one Sell recommendations issued in the past three months.', 'The average NVDA price target of $260.00 implies 43.65% upside from current levels.', 'Read more analyst ratings on NVDA stock

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']

The stock of Nvidia has a consensus Strong Buy rating among 42 Wall Street analysts.

title: 2026 IPO Alert: Nvidia Rival Cerebras Systems Targets Debut in Q2
article:
['AI chipmaker Cerebras Systems (PC:CER66) is gearing up to file for a U.S. initial public offering (IPO) in the next week and is aiming to go public as early as the second quarter of 2026, Reuters reported.', 'The move comes as demand for specialized AI hardware continues to surge, driven by the rapid adoption of large language models, and enterprise AI workloads.', 'Also, the need for alternatives to Nvidia’s (NVDA) dominant GPU ecosystem continues to grow.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Moreover, the filing news comes after Cerebras pulled its IPO filing in October 2025 after initially filing in late 2024.', 'The company withdrew the offering days after raising more than $1 billion in fresh funding, citing the need to update financials, strategy, and ongoing U.S. national‑security scrutiny tied to its former investor, Abu Dhabi-based G42.', 'Cerebras Lays Ground for IPO

Cerebras has been preparing for an IPO by expanding partnerships, increasing production of its wafer-scale AI chips, and boosting its financial position.', 'The company’s Wafer Scale Engine is one of the largest AI processors, designed to train large models faster and more efficiently than traditional GPU systems.', 'This has helped the company win deals with cloud providers, research labs, and government agencies that need high-performance AI computing.', 'A 2026 IPO would give Cerebras a chance to tap into strong demand for AI infrastructure.', 'Also, investors are looking for companies that can benefit from the next wave of AI.', 'Further, Cerebras’ unique technology makes it appealing as the industry looks for scalable, energy-efficient computing.', 'Is NVDA a Strong Buy?', 'Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Strong Buy consensus rating on NVDA stock based on 40 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell assigned in the past three months.', 'Further, the average Nvidia price target of $260 per share implies 44.30% upside potential.', 'See more NVDA analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']

Also, the need for alternatives to Nvidia’s (NVDA) dominant GPU ecosystem continues to grow. Cerebras Lays Ground for IPO

Cerebras has been preparing for an IPO by expanding partnerships, increasing production of its wafer-scale AI chips, and boosting its financial position. The company’s Wafer Scale Engine is one of the largest AI processors, designed to train large models faster and more efficiently than traditional GPU systems. title: Intel Stock (NASDAQ:INTC) Jumps as Nvidia Deal Gets Green Light
article:
['Chip stock Intel (INTC) got another welcome bit of news from the federal government, who recently put a big pile of cash into Intel’s operations.', 'The previously-revealed deal with Nvidia (NVDA) has been cleared by federal antitrust officials, and gives Intel another hefty slug of cash to work with.', 'Investors’ spirits were buoyed as well, and Intel shares jumped over 3% in Friday afternoon’s trading.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) cleared the way for Nvidia to invest in Intel.', 'Though it did not illustrate any details of the arrangement, reports noted that Nvidia was planning to put $5 billion in Intel all the way back in September.', 'There were concerns that the investment might reduce competition in the market, but these must not have been sufficiently significant for the government to get concerned.', 'Naturally, a deal like this is huge for Intel.', 'Intel has been frantically cutting costs for the last several months now, and an extra $5 billion—which represents about a month’s revenue based on third-quarter earnings reports—will certainly help pull cost pressures off of Intel.', 'Further, Intel can benefit greatly from an association with Nvidia, who has delivered consistently in the AI infrastructure arena for years now.', 'That is also a field Intel has been playing catch-up in for almost as long.', 'Increasingly Attractive

Better yet, Intel has a growing body of potential customers, a point it also desperately needs right now.', 'Nvidia and AMD (AMD) are both reportedly looking at the upcoming 14A node for production duties, and both Apple (AAPL) and Broadcom (AVGO) are looking into Intel’s EMIB packaging for a new project: a “custom server accelerator,” reports note.', 'One of the biggest reasons for all this interest in Intel is an unfortunate consequence of the market.', 'TSMC (TSM) is booked, and pretty solidly, too; “capacity limits” at the chipmaker are forcing companies to look elsewhere as TSMC simply cannot accommodate.', 'Is Intel a Buy, Hold or Sell?', 'Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Hold consensus rating on INTC stock based on five Buys, 24 Holds and six Sells assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below.', 'After a 93.32% rally in its share price over the past year, the average INTC price target of $37.25 per share implies 2.24% upside potential.', 'See more INTC analyst ratings

Disclosure

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences:
Chip stock Intel (INTC) got another welcome bit of news from the federal government, who recently put a big pile of cash into Intel’s operations. The previously-revealed deal with Nvidia (NVDA) has been cleared by federal antitrust officials, and gives Intel another hefty slug of cash to work with. Investors’ spirits were buoyed as well, and Intel shares jumped over 3% in Friday afternoon’s trading. Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) cleared the way for Nvidia to invest in Intel. Though it did not illustrate any details of the arrangement, reports noted that Nvidia was planning to put $5 billion in Intel all the way back in September. Naturally, a deal like this is huge for Intel. Intel has been frantically cutting costs for the last several months now, and an extra $5 billion—which represents about a month’s revenue based on third-quarter earnings reports—will certainly help pull cost pressures off of Intel. Further, Intel can benefit greatly from an association with Nvidia, who has delivered consistently in the AI infrastructure arena for years now. That is also a field Intel has been playing catch-up in for almost as long. Increasingly Attractive

Better yet, Intel has a growing body of potential customers, a point it also desperately needs right now. Nvidia and AMD (AMD) are both reportedly looking at the upcoming 14A node for production duties, and both Apple (AAPL) and Broadcom (AVGO) are looking into Intel’s EMIB packaging for a new project: a “custom server accelerator,” reports note. One of the biggest reasons for all this interest in Intel is an unfortunate consequence of the market. Is Intel a Buy, Hold or Sell?

title: Nvidia’s (NVDA) $5B Bet on Intel Wins FTC Approval, Stocks Surge Over 3%
article:
['U.S. regulators have officially cleared Nvidia’s (NVDA) planned $5 billion investment in Intel (INTC), removing a major hurdle for one of the major partnerships in the semiconductor industry.', 'The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) posted the approval notice, confirming that the deal can move forward.', 'Following the news, both NVDA and INTC stocks jumped over 3.3% on Friday.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Despite concerns over potential monopolistic influence, FTC’s approval signals that regulators do not currently view this minority stake as a violation of antitrust laws.', 'Nvidia’s Investment to Give Intel a Boost

The deal, originally announced in September 2025, involved Nvidia purchasing Intel common stock at $23.28 per share, providing a major “lifeline” to the struggling chipmaker.', 'Beyond the capital infusion, the two companies formed a multi-generational partnership to co-develop custom data center and personal computing products.', 'The collaboration involves combining Intel CPUs with Nvidia GPU chiplets.', 'For Intel, Nvidia’s investment provides meaningful support as it works to regain manufacturing leadership.', 'The company has been aggressively expanding its foundry business, aiming to produce chips not only for itself but for external customers as well.', 'For Nvidia, the deal provides greater manufacturing flexibility at a time when demand for AI chips continues to surge.', 'Is NVDA a Strong Buy?', 'Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Strong Buy consensus rating on NVDA stock based on 40 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell assigned in the past three months.', 'Further, the average Nvidia price target of $260 per share implies 44.30% upside potential.', 'See more NVDA analyst ratings

Is INTC Stock a Buy or Sell?', 'Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Hold consensus rating on INTC stock based on five Buys, 22 Holds, and six Sells assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below.', 'Furthermore, the average Intel price target of $37.40 per share implies 0.16% downside risk.', 'See more INTC analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences:
U.S. regulators have officially cleared Nvidia’s (NVDA) planned $5 billion investment in Intel (INTC), removing a major hurdle for one of the major partnerships in the semiconductor industry. Nvidia’s Investment to Give Intel a Boost

The deal, originally announced in September 2025, involved Nvidia purchasing Intel common stock at $23.28 per share, providing a major “lifeline” to the struggling chipmaker. Beyond the capital infusion, the two companies formed a multi-generational partnership to co-develop custom data center and personal computing products. The collaboration involves combining Intel CPUs with Nvidia GPU chiplets. For Intel, Nvidia’s investment provides meaningful support as it works to regain manufacturing leadership. For Nvidia, the deal provides greater manufacturing flexibility at a time when demand for AI chips continues to surge. Further, the average Nvidia price target of $260 per share implies 44.30% upside potential. Furthermore, the average Intel price target of $37.40 per share implies 0.16% downside risk.

title: AI Daily: OpenAI signs MOU with DOE, seeks to raise $100B
article:
['Catch up on the top artificial intelligence news and commentary by Wall Street analysts on publicly traded companies in the space with this daily recap compiled by The Fly:

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

FUNDING ROUND: Microsoft (MSFT)-backed OpenAI is seeking to raise as much as $100B as it tries to pay for ambitious growth plans in a market that has ebbed recently on the AI boom, the Wall Street Journal’s Kate Clark and Berber Jin report.', 'The latest funding round for the ChatGPT maker, which is in the early stages, could value it at as high as $830B if it raises the full amount it is aiming for, the authors say, citing people familiar with the matter.', 'The AI company is seeking to complete the round by the end of Q1 at the earliest, the authors say, noting that the terms of the deal could still change and it is unclear whether there will be sufficient shareholder demand to reach the target.', 'OpenAI is anticipated to recruit sovereign wealth funds to participate in the funding, given the scale, the authors say, citing people familiar with the matter.', 'OPENAI, DOE SIGN MOU: OpenAI and the U.S. Department of Energy have signed a memorandum of understanding to deepen our collaboration on AI and advanced computing in support of DOE initiatives, including the Genesis Mission.', 'This work is part of OpenAI for Science, an effort to help scientists accelerate discovery by pairing frontier AI models with the tools, workflows, and expertise of real research environments.', '“This MOU builds on OpenAI’s existing work with DOE’s national laboratories, where we’ve already deployed frontier models in real research environments and worked directly with scientists on high-impact problems,” the company said.', 'OpenAI also submitted detailed recommendations to the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy on how the United States can strengthen science and technology leadership through AI.', 'That filing outlines why the company sees 2026 as a “Year of Science” and why access to frontier AI models, compute, and real research environments is essential to accelerating discovery, it added.', 'This announcement follows today’s Genesis Mission event at the White House, where Kevin Weil, Vice President of OpenAI for Science, joined DOE and other partners.', 'CHATGPT LICENSES: OpenAI has sold more than 700,000 ChatGPT licenses to about 35 public universities for use by students and faculty, Bloomberg’s Brody Ford and Liam Knox report.', 'Students and faculty used ChatGPT more than 14 million times in September, with each user calling on it 176 times that month for help with tasks such as writing, research and data analysis, according to the report, which adds that OpenAI has sold “well over a million” licenses to colleges globally, with schools willing to purchase bulk access to ChatGPT paying a few dollars per user per month.', 'Meanwhile, Microsoft, which typically bundles its Copilot assistant with existing software, has experienced more “measured” uptake of its AI tool at these schools, Ford and Knox write.', 'H200 CHIP SALES: U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration has launched a review that may end with allowing Nvidia’s (NVDA) H200 chips to be shipped to China, Alexandra Alper of Reuters reports, citing five sources.', 'Trump said earlier this month that he would allow the sales of the chips to China, with the U.S. collecting a 25% fee, believing the sales would help keep U.S. firms ahead of Chinese chipmakers by cutting demand in China.', 'Questions remain over how quickly the U.S. may approve of the sales and whether Beijing would allow Chinese firms to purchase the chips.', 'NEW AI MODEL: Meta Platforms (META) is working on a new image and video-focused AI model code-named Mango alongside the Facebook parent’s next text-based large language model, the Wall Street Journal’s Meghan Bobrowsky reports.', 'In an internal company Q&A Thursday, Meta chief AI officer Alexandr Wang discussed the AI models with chief product officer Chris Cox, the author says, citing people who heard the remarks.', 'The models are anticipated to be released in the first half of 2026, the author notes.']
key_sentences:

title: Midday Fly By: Nike reports Q2 beat, TikTok to sell U.S. unit

title: AMD Stock Soars Alongside Bullish Analyst Coverage
article:
['Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock was on the rise Friday after a top analyst weighed in on the semiconductor company.', 'Five-star Mizuho Securities analyst Vijay Rakesh reiterated a Buy rating for AMD stock.', 'This rating comes at a time when semiconductor stocks are a hot topic due to the high demand for their server components.', 'These are needed in the data centers that power artificial intelligence (AI), which has undergone massive growth in 2025.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Rakesh isn’t the only top analyst who has weighed in on AMD stock today.', 'Five-star Truist Financial analyst William Stein also maintained a Buy rating for the shares.', 'However, the analyst also lowered his price target to $277 per share from $279 per share, which still suggests a possible 31.12% upside despite the cut.', 'Stein’s bullish coverage of AMD stock is due to his belief that AI infrastructure semiconductor stocks “remain cheap” when compared to the growth they’ve seen.', 'AMD isn’t the only stock that the Truist analyst praised in his recent note to clients.', 'He also highlighted Nvidia (NVDA) and Broadcom (AVGO) as semiconductor stocks that will benefit from the AI boom.', 'Interestingly, Stein doesn’t have the same hope for Intel (INTC), which he has assigned a Hold rating and $39 price target, suggesting a 7.5% upside.', 'AMD Stock Movement Today

AMD stock was up 4.79% on Friday, extending a 74.43% rally year-to-date.', 'The stock has also increased 68.66% over the past 12 months.', 'Is AMD Stock a Buy, Sell, or Hold?', 'Turning to Wall Street, the analysts’ consensus rating for AMD is Strong Buy, based on 31 Buy and nine Hold ratings over the past three months.', 'With that comes an average AMD stock price target of $279.67, representing a potential 32.77% upside for the shares.', 'See more AMD stock analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']

label: NVDA
title: Trump Trade: Trump increasing medical marijuana, cannabidiol research
article:
['Catch up on the top industries and stocks that were impacted, or were predicted to be impacted, by the comments, actions and policies of President Donald Trump with this daily recap compiled by The Fly.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

MARIJUANA ORDER: President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order that will “improve medical marijuana and cannabidiol research to better inform patients and doctors,” the White House stated in a fact sheet.', '“The Order directs the Attorney General to expedite completion of the process of rescheduling marijuana to Schedule III of the Controlled Substance Act; The Order directs the White House Deputy Chief of Staff for Legislative, Political, and Public Affairs to work with the Congress to allow Americans to benefit from access to appropriate full-spectrum CBD products while still restricting the sale of products that pose serious health risks; The Order directs HHS to develop research methods and models utilizing real-world evidence to improve access to hemp-derived cannabinoid products in accordance with Federal law and to inform standards of care,” the White House fact sheet stated.', 'NOT LEGALIZATION: President Trump says marijuana executive order is “not legalization.” Publicly traded companies in the cannabis space include Aurora Cannabis (ACB), CV Sciences (CVSI), Canopy Growth (CGC), Cronos Group (CRON), Goodness Growth (GDNSF), Green Thumb Industries (GTBIF), IGC Pharma (IGC), Tilray (TLRY), Trees Corporation (CANN) and Trulieve Cannabis (TCNNF).', 'U.S. LAUNCHES REVIEW: U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration has launched a review that may end with allowing Nvidia’s (NVDA) H200 chips to be shipped to China, Alexandra Alper of Reuters reports, citing five sources.', 'Trump said earlier this month that he would allow the sales of the chips to China, with the U.S. collecting a 25% fee, believing the sales would help keep U.S. firms ahead of Chinese chipmakers by cutting demand in China.', 'Questions remain over how quickly the U.S. may approve of the sales and whether Beijing would allow Chinese firms to purchase the chips.']
key_sentences: U.S. LAUNCHES REVIEW: U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration has launched a review that may end with allowing Nvidia’s (NVDA) H200 chips to be shipped to China, Alexandra Alper of Reuters reports, citing five sources.

title: Trump Admin Begins Review of Nvidia (NVDA) AI Chip Exports to China
article:
['U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration has commenced a review that could lead to Nvidia’s (NVDA) first shipment of H200 AI (artificial intelligence) chips to China, Reuters reported.', 'Recently, Trump said that he would allow the chip giant to export its H200 chips to China if the company agrees to pay a 25% fee to the U.S government.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Trump Admin Launches Review of Nvidia Chip Exports Amid Challenges

Reportedly, the U.S. Commerce Department has forwarded license applications for the chip sales to the State, Energy, and Defense Departments for review.', 'According to export regulations, these agencies have 30 days to assess the applications.', 'While the Trump administration has launched a review that would allow Nvidia to begin exporting the H200 AI chip to China, the move is drawing opposition from many U.S. politicians.', 'Notably, there are fears that China might use such advanced chips to bolster its military’s capabilities and threaten the dominance of the U.S. in AI.', 'However, experts in the Trump administration argue that shipping advanced AI chips to China discourages Chinese competitors like Huawei from increasing their efforts to compete with Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices’ (AMD) advanced tech.', 'Meanwhile, there is uncertainty about whether the Chinese government will allow companies in the country to buy Nvidia chips.', 'China has been urging domestic companies to boost local chip production to reduce reliance on the U.S. and to ensure national security.', 'Interestingly, Reuters reported last week that Nvidia is evaluating increasing production of its H200 chips after initial orders from Chinese companies exceeded its existing capacity.', 'Is NVDA Stock a Buy, Sell, or Hold?', 'Despite ongoing concerns about AI valuations and rising competition in the AI chip space, Wall Street has a Strong Buy consensus rating on Nvidia stock based on 40 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell recommendation.', 'The average NVDA stock price target of $261.31 indicates 50% upside potential from current levels.', 'See more NVDA analyst ratings.', 'Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences:
U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration has commenced a review that could lead to Nvidia’s (NVDA) first shipment of H200 AI (artificial intelligence) chips to China, Reuters reported. Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Trump Admin Launches Review of Nvidia Chip Exports Amid Challenges

Reportedly, the U.S. Commerce Department has forwarded license applications for the chip sales to the State, Energy, and Defense Departments for review. While the Trump administration has launched a review that would allow Nvidia to begin exporting the H200 AI chip to China, the move is drawing opposition from many U.S. politicians. However, experts in the Trump administration argue that shipping advanced AI chips to China discourages Chinese competitors like Huawei from increasing their efforts to compete with Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices’ (AMD) advanced tech. Meanwhile, there is uncertainty about whether the Chinese government will allow companies in the country to buy Nvidia chips. Interestingly, Reuters reported last week that Nvidia is evaluating increasing production of its H200 chips after initial orders from Chinese companies exceeded its existing capacity. Despite ongoing concerns about AI valuations and rising competition in the AI chip space, Wall Street has a Strong Buy consensus rating on Nvidia stock based on 40 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell recommendation.

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

With that outlook in mind, investors are likely wondering what the company’s maximum potential is.', 'On the bullish end, NVDA stock has a street-high price target of $352 per share.', 'This price target came from top analyst Mark Lipacis at Evercore ISI late last month following the company’s strong Q3 results and upbeat guidance.', 'If NVDA can reach that value, it would represent a 105.9% rally from the stock’s current price.', 'Unsurprisingly, Lipacis also holds an Outperform rating on the stock.', 'On the other end of the range, the lowest analyst price target for NVDA stands at $200 per share.', 'That target comes from four-star Phillip Securities analyst Yik Ban Chong and points to a more modest 17% upside.', 'Even so, the analyst still rates the stock a Buy, indicating confidence that Nvidia can continue to move higher.', 'Chong updated his NVDA outlook late last month.', 'NVDA Stock Movement Today

After a decline of about 4% on Wednesday, NVDA stock rebounded in pre-market trading, rising more than 1%.', 'The shares have also increased 27.3% year-to-date and 32.6% over the past 12 months.', 'Much of this rally has been driven by the rising demand for its AI chips.', 'As companies and governments ramp up spending on AI data centers, Nvidia’s GPUs continue to be the top choice for running and training AI models.', 'Is NVDA a Good Stock to Buy Now?', 'According to TipRanks, NVDA stock has a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 39 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell assigned in the last three months.', 'At $258.97, the Nvidia average share price target implies a 51.50% upside potential.', 'See more NVDA analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences: Nvidia (NVDA) enters 2026 with expectations still running high after a massive multi-year rally driven by AI spending. While Nvidia already has a large market value, Wall Street still believes the stock could have meaningful upside ahead, with analysts pointing to gains of more than 50% from current levels. Even so, the analyst still rates the stock a Buy, indicating confidence that Nvidia can continue to move higher. Much of this rally has been driven by the rising demand for its AI chips. As companies and governments ramp up spending on AI data centers, Nvidia’s GPUs continue to be the top choice for running and training AI models. At $258.97, the Nvidia average share price target implies a 51.50% upside potential.

title: Nvidia Stock (NVDA) Volatility Signals Bullish Options Setup
article:
['It doesn’t look like much from the outside, so to speak, but semiconductor giant Nvidia (NVDA) just flashed a rare quantitative signal.', 'From past analogs, we can study the potential forward impact of the signal, which has bullish implications for NVDA stock.', 'Therefore, I consider the tech juggernaut a Buy — but under a careful, options-based framework.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Let’s spend a moment discussing methodology.', 'Unlike much of the finance content that focuses heavily on revisiting past news events, this analysis takes a different approach.', 'If you follow NVDA stock closely, you’re likely already familiar with its primary risks and potential rewards.', 'Instead, I’d like to focus our time on the quantitative factors that influence share price movement.', 'In many traditional frameworks, price is modeled primarily as a function of time.', 'However, a more nuanced view is that a security’s value is a function of its underlying “state.” While that state cannot be directly observed, it reflects the combined influence of numerous variables — including institutional activity, macroeconomic conditions, and broader market sentiment — that interact dynamically.', 'Since this underlying state cannot be measured directly, the most practical alternative is to evaluate its expected impact.', 'In other words, while we may not fully understand the origin of every catalyst, we can assess the effects those catalysts tend to produce when they emerge.', 'This is the essence of a quantitative approach to market analysis.', 'Viewed through this lens, NVDA stock currently presents an opportunity that merits closer examination.', 'Thinking About NVDA Stock Distributionally

While arguments can easily arise when discussing investment methodologies, when it comes to trading options, the quantitative approach—framed within a distributional analysis—is arguably the most effective.', 'That’s because we’re letting the empirical data reveal the probabilistic structure of demand.', 'Let’s consider technical analysis for a moment.', 'Adherents of this discipline believe that historical price action reveals insights into forward behaviors.', 'While I generally agree with the broad premise, I have become highly skeptical of the methodology.', 'Simply put, market technicians take a single strand of continuous price data and project a likely path forward.', 'Ultimately, though, these analysts are intuiting an outlook.', 'As psychologist Dr. Ellen Langer noted in her groundbreaking work on the “illusion of control,” humans tend to mislead themselves about interpreting causality in purely random events.', 'Biologically, that’s because our senses are attuned to finding slithering snakes hiding in the bushes.', 'They’re not meant to uncover structural arbitrage within heteroskedastic markets.', 'If you’re wondering what the heck that last sentence meant, that’s precisely my point.', 'The market is non-linear, reflexive, and heteroskedastic — along with a bunch of other terms that even the most diehard English Lit major would have to look up.', 'You’re not reliably intuiting anything in the market.', 'Instead, we need to rely on distributional analysis to truly make sense of NVDA stock or any other security.', 'Think of it this way.', 'When you look at NVDA’s price chart, you just see a singular journey across time.', 'That just tells you what happened yesterday and all the yesterdays that the chart fills.', 'Now imagine cutting NVDA stock into rolling sequences of 10 weeks each.', 'With a five-year chart, you would have a distribution of almost 300 10-week trials.', 'Here’s where the magic happens.', 'If a few of those weeks featured one-off volatile events, they wouldn’t carry as much weight relative to the entire distribution.', 'However, if 200 of these trials showed steady bullish behavior, then you would see a bulge in the most optimistic zone of the distribution.', 'That bulge is structure or risk geometry — and it’s everything in how we analyze NVDA stock’s multiverse.', 'Opening Your Eyes to the Most Empirically Efficient Trades

One of the intellectual consequences of distributional thinking is that it opens your eyes to a radical paradigm shift.', 'Rather than viewing the future as a deterministic path illuminated only by the passage of time, we see the market for what it fundamentally is: a metaverse.', 'Indeed, when you look at the NVDA stock options table, you see the truth for yourself.', 'People are literally capitalizing on the risk of alternative versions of reality.', 'You might argue that in-demand options reflect the heightened possibility of the underlying reality coming true, forcing traders to either hedge against it or speculate on it.', 'Chart showing the standard and bimodal distribution of NVDA’s price action.', 'Credit: Joshua Enomoto

For NVDA stock, its forward 10-week distributions range between $166 and $211, assuming an anchor price of $177.72, Tuesday’s close.', 'However, we’re interested in the current quant signal, which is the 3-7-D sequence; that is, in the trailing 10 weeks, NVDA printed only three up weeks, leading to an overall downward slope.', 'Usually, extended bearishness is problematic.', 'However, NVDA stock statistically attracts buy-the-dip sentiment.', 'Following the signal, the forward 10-week returns typically range between $173 and $201, with price clustering likely to be predominant at around $192.', 'With that risk geometry in mind, I’m taking a long look at the 185/190 bull call spread expiring February 20, 2026.', 'This wager involves two simultaneous transactions on a single ticket: buy the $185 call and sell the $190 call, for a net debit of $195 (the maximum possible loss).', 'Chart showing NVDA’s probability density.', 'Credit: Joshua Enomoto

Should NVDA stock rise through the second-leg strike of $190 at expiration, the maximum profit is $305, a payout of over 156%.', 'Breakeven lands at $186.95.', 'What I like about this trade isn’t just about the probabilistic credibility of reaching $190.', 'Rather, it’s that from $190 to $195, the probability density drops by 47.31%.', 'From $195 onward, density simply craters.', 'Therefore, the trade is empirically efficient — it gives you a robust payout and limits the absorption of opportunity cost.', 'Is NVDA a Buy, Sell, or Hold?', 'Turning to Wall Street, NVDA stock has a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 40 Buy, one Hold, and one Sell rating.', 'The average NVDA price target is $261.31, implying almost 50% upside potential over the course of 2026.', 'Readjusting Our Framework for Nvidia Stock

At the core, the value of NVDA stock is a function of state — but what that state is remains a mystery.', 'Subsequently, the next best approach is to calculate the influence of this state, and that involves distributional analysis.', 'Through this approach, we can see the structure and geometry of risk, enabling us to make better trading decisions.', 'Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences:
It doesn’t look like much from the outside, so to speak, but semiconductor giant Nvidia (NVDA) just flashed a rare quantitative signal. Opening Your Eyes to the Most Empirically Efficient Trades

One of the intellectual consequences of distributional thinking is that it opens your eyes to a radical paradigm shift. Readjusting Our Framework for Nvidia Stock

At the core, the value of NVDA stock is a function of state — but what that state is remains a mystery.

title: JPMorgan Quants Identify 6 Stocks at Risk of a Sharp Reversal
article:
['Recent market volatility in U.S. stocks has led JPMorgan (JPM) to warn about “extreme crowding” in a handful of fast-rising, speculative growth names.', 'More specifically, strategists at the bank have highlighted six stocks that they believe are especially at risk of a sharp reversal if a major macro event occurs.', 'These include:

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Broadcom (AVGO)

Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)

Expedia Group (EXPE)

Estee Lauder (EL)

Invesco (IVZ)

Nucor (NUE)

Indeed, JPMorgan’s quant team noted that crowding in volatile and risky stocks had hit the 99th percentile, which is an extreme level that often leads to sudden selloffs.', 'According to Bram Kaplan, the firm’s head of Americas equity derivatives strategy, these stocks are more vulnerable to shocks, while lower volatility stocks like Cigna Group (CI), Pfizer (PFE), and Verizon Communications (VZ) offer better risk-reward profiles.', 'Interestingly, shares of Broadcom, AMD, Estee Lauder, Invesco, and Nucor have declined since December 10, with only Expedia showing a slight gain.', 'JPMorgan calls these “second-order speculative AI beneficiaries,” which means that they are stocks investors flocked to after already bidding up names like Nvidia (NVDA) and Microsoft (MSFT).', 'Because these companies often rely on capital markets for growth, they’re more exposed to volatility.', 'Still, the recent selloff might be temporary, as Micron (MU) surprised markets with strong earnings that lifted AI stocks again.', 'Which Stock Is the Better Buy?', 'Overall, out of the crowded stocks mentioned above, analysts think that Broadcom has the most room to run.', 'In fact, Broadcom’s average price target of $461.93 per share implies more than 41% upside potential.', 'See more AVGO analyst ratings

label: NVDA
title: Forget Nvidia (NVDA) — Focus on This Top AI Stock Instead in 2026
article:
['Nvidia (NVDA) has led the artificial intelligence (AI) boom for the past few years, powering everything from large language models to massive data centers.', 'As we move into 2026, NVDA is still a powerhouse, but its explosive growth is slowing, and competition is picking up.', 'Thus, investors are looking for the next big winner in AI, and that stock is Advanced Micro Devices (AMD).', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Why Look Beyond Nvidia?', 'Nvidia is still the face of the AI boom, but its share price growth in 2025 has not been as rapid as in recent years.', 'The stock has risen about 30% so far in 2025, which is solid but slower than the gains in other AI companies, which doubled over the same period.', 'Meanwhile, demand for AI compute keeps climbing, and hyperscalers are searching for cheaper, high-performance alternatives.', 'Consequently, rivals such as AMD, Intel (INTC), and custom chips from Amazon (AMZN), Google (GOOGL), and Microsoft (MSFT) are gaining ground.', 'As more options enter the market, Nvidia’s pricing power and market share could face pressure.', 'Finally, NVDA stock makes up a large part of major stock indices, so even small drops in its price can drag the market down.', 'Diversifying across other AI-related companies can help reduce that concentration risk.', 'AMD Is Quietly Becoming a Major AI Winner

AMD is becoming a major player in the AI market, with support from its open software ecosystem, fast-growing data center business, and several high-profile partnerships.', 'Its data center business has become a key part of its AI strategy.', 'In Q3 2025, the segment hit a record $4.3 billion in revenue, up 22% year-over-year.', 'Importantly, AMD’s hardware is now being deployed by major AI players, including Meta (META), Microsoft, OpenAI (PC:OPAIQ), and Oracle (ORCL).', 'While Nvidia dominates AI training, AMD is focusing on the fast-growing AI inference market, which many analysts expect to become even larger than training workloads.', 'AMD’s Instinct GPUs are built to deliver strong performance at a lower total cost, making them especially attractive to cloud providers facing rising infrastructure expenses.', 'Looking ahead, management expects AMD’s revenue to grow over 35% annually over the next three to five years, a sharp acceleration from its past growth rate.', 'On top of that, the company is gearing up to launch its next‑generation MI400 AI accelerators in 2026.', 'This move could further challenge Nvidia’s dominance in data center GPUs.', 'Conclusion

Nvidia will stay a major player in AI, but investors looking for other options should keep a close eye on AMD.', 'With rising revenue, expanding market share, and a strong product roadmap heading into 2026, AMD seems to have strong upside potential.', 'Is AMD a Buy or Sell Now?', 'Turning to Wall Street, AMD stock has a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 29 Buys and nine Holds assigned in the last three months.', 'At $282.39, the average AMD price target implies a 40.46% upside potential.', 'See more AMD analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences:
Nvidia (NVDA) has led the artificial intelligence (AI) boom for the past few years, powering everything from large language models to massive data centers. Thus, investors are looking for the next big winner in AI, and that stock is Advanced Micro Devices (AMD). Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Why Look Beyond Nvidia? Nvidia is still the face of the AI boom, but its share price growth in 2025 has not been as rapid as in recent years. Consequently, rivals such as AMD, Intel (INTC), and custom chips from Amazon (AMZN), Google (GOOGL), and Microsoft (MSFT) are gaining ground. As more options enter the market, Nvidia’s pricing power and market share could face pressure. AMD Is Quietly Becoming a Major AI Winner

AMD is becoming a major player in the AI market, with support from its open software ecosystem, fast-growing data center business, and several high-profile partnerships. Its data center business has become a key part of its AI strategy. Importantly, AMD’s hardware is now being deployed by major AI players, including Meta (META), Microsoft, OpenAI (PC:OPAIQ), and Oracle (ORCL). While Nvidia dominates AI training, AMD is focusing on the fast-growing AI inference market, which many analysts expect to become even larger than training workloads. AMD’s Instinct GPUs are built to deliver strong performance at a lower total cost, making them especially attractive to cloud providers facing rising infrastructure expenses. Looking ahead, management expects AMD’s revenue to grow over 35% annually over the next three to five years, a sharp acceleration from its past growth rate. This move could further challenge Nvidia’s dominance in data center GPUs. Conclusion

Nvidia will stay a major player in AI, but investors looking for other options should keep a close eye on AMD. With rising revenue, expanding market share, and a strong product roadmap heading into 2026, AMD seems to have strong upside potential. Is AMD a Buy or Sell Now? Turning to Wall Street, AMD stock has a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 29 Buys and nine Holds assigned in the last three months. At $282.39, the average AMD price target implies a 40.46% upside potential. See more AMD analyst ratings

article:
['Catch up on the top artificial intelligence news and commentary by Wall Street analysts on publicly traded companies in the space with this daily recap compiled by The Fly:

CAPITAL RAISE: OpenAI has held preliminary conversations with investors regarding a capital raise of as much as $100B, valuing the company at about $750B, The Information reports, citing people familiar with discussions.', 'Valuation at that level would be 50% higher than OpenAI’s last share sale, the report states.', 'AI CHIPS: Google (GOOGL) is developing a new initiative to make AI chips better at PyTorch, an open-source project supported by Meta Platforms (META), Krystal Hu, Kenrick Cai and Stephen Nellis of Reuters reports.', 'The move is aimed to weakening Nvidia’s (NVDA) dominance in the AI computing market, people familiar with the matter said.', 'This effort is part of Google’s plan to make its Tensor Processing Units an alternative to Nvidia’s GPUs.', 'ALL-IN BET: Sources detail CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s all-in bet to make Meta an AI leader, with some saying Alexandr Wang finds Zuckerberg’s micromanagement of AI work suffocating, The Financial Times’ Hannah Murphy and George Hammond report.', 'AI SOLUTIONS: Cognizant (CTSH) announced a multi-year strategic partnership with Microsoft (MSFT) to help global enterprises become AI-powered frontier firms.', 'Cognizant and Microsoft will co-build industry-grade AI solutions, jointly co-sell globally and collaborate on large-scale deals across key sectors including Financial Services, Healthcare and Life Sciences, Retail, and Manufacturing.', 'The partnership will embed agentic AI and Copilot powered by Work IQ, Foundry IQ and Fabric IQ capabilities into mission-critical workflows.', 'This partnership also expands on the Cognizant Neuro AI Suite of offerings Cognizant is bringing to the market which leverage Microsoft cloud and AI services.', 'Cognizant will scale Microsoft 365 Copilot and GitHub Copilot adoption across delivery and consulting teams, while upskilling associates on Microsoft Azure, Azure AI Foundry, and related technologies.', 'The collaboration will also harness Cognizant’s proprietary platforms, including TriZetto, Skygrade, and FlowSource, to deliver sector-specific advancements and modernize software engineering at scale.', 'COLLABORATION: Dynatrace (DT)announced it has expanded its collaboration with Google Cloud to become a launch partner for Gemini CLI extensions and Gemini Enterprise.', 'The Dynatrace Gemini CLI extension gives developers access to observability and root-cause analysis directly within their terminal.', 'In addition, Dynatrace’s AI-driven integrations are now available through Google Cloud Marketplace.']

title: 2026 Market Forecast: Yardeni Sees Investors Rotating Away From the “Magnificent Seven”
article:
['Yardeni Research says investors are rotating out of the Magnificent Seven stocks and into the broader S&P 500 Index (SPX), a shift the firm thinks could continue through 2026.', 'This rotation is due to concerns that heavy AI spending is putting pressure on the cash flows of large tech companies, while AI adoption boosts productivity and profit margins across the rest of the market.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Importantly, the research firm has shifted from an “overweight” view on big tech to an “underweight” stance, now favoring Financials, Industrials, and Healthcare instead.', 'The firm believes these sectors can use AI to boost productivity without bearing the high upfront costs of building AI infrastructure.', 'In a recent note, Yardeni stated that the traditional year-end “Santa Claus rally” may be harder to sustain this year.', 'The firm even declared “Mission Accomplished” on its 7,000-year-end target for the S&P 500 after the index hit 6,901 on December 11, suggesting that may be the high for the year.', 'Why Yardeni Thinks the Rotation Is Happening

Yardeni argues that the Magnificent Seven, Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL), Amazon (AMZN), Meta (META), Tesla (TSLA), and Nvidia (NVDA), may be entering a correction phase similar to the DeepSeek episode earlier this year.', 'Before the AI boom, these companies generated strong cash flow thanks to relatively low labor and capital spending.', 'However, the race to dominate AI is causing them to invest tens of billions in infrastructure, which is squeezing their margins and increasing competition among them.', 'Meanwhile, the rest of the S&P 500, what Yardeni calls the “Impressive 493,” trades at far more attractive valuations.', 'The Magnificent Seven currently commands a forward-price-to-sales ratio of 7.8, compared to just 2.5 for the broader index.', 'The research firm noted that the Magnificent Seven’s market cap has doubled to $20 trillion over the past two years and now represents 31.7% of the entire S&P 500.', 'This is an unusually high level of concentration that Yardeni believes is unsustainable.', 'Which Magnificent 7 Stocks to Buy?', 'Now, let’s see how Wall Street analysts are rating these seven mega-cap tech stocks, and which stock they believe has the strongest upside.', 'Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences:
Why Yardeni Thinks the Rotation Is Happening

Yardeni argues that the Magnificent Seven, Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL), Amazon (AMZN), Meta (META), Tesla (TSLA), and Nvidia (NVDA), may be entering a correction phase similar to the DeepSeek episode earlier this year.

title: Nvidia’s (NVDA) RTX PRO 5000 GPU for AI Tasks Is Now Generally Available
article:
['Chipmaker Nvidia (NVDA) has made its new graphics card, called the RTX PRO 5000, generally available.', 'Interestingly, it comes with 72GB of memory and is built on its powerful new “Blackwell” chip design.', 'This GPU is designed for AI developers, engineers, and designers who work on large and complex projects.', 'It’s especially useful for training AI models or running tools that think and respond in real time.', 'This new version adds to the earlier 48GB model.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

This new GPU matters because AI requires a lot of memory and speed.', 'In fact, today’s AI tools often need to run many different systems at the same time, such as chatbots, video tools, and voice recognition, which can be too much for older chips.', 'The RTX PRO 5000 solves this by offering 72GB of fast memory and very high processing power (2,142 trillion calculations every second).', 'This lets users train and use AI tools right on their own machines instead of depending on cloud data centers, which helps improve speed, protect private data, and cut costs.', 'Notably, some companies are already using the new GPU and seeing big improvements.', 'For example, InfinitForm is using it to speed up product design, while Versatile Media is using it for real-time video production.', 'In tests, this new GPU was 3.5 times faster at generating images and twice as fast at generating text compared to previous Nvidia models.', 'It also helped creative professionals render 3D visuals nearly five times faster in some software.', 'What Is a Good Price for NVDA?', 'Turning to Wall Street, analysts have a Strong Buy consensus rating on NVDA stock based on 39 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell assigned in the past three months, as indicated by the graphic below.', 'Furthermore, the average NVDA price target of $258.97 per share implies 47.7% upside potential.', 'See more NVDA analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']

article:

The breakout was fueled by an insatiable demand for High-Bandwidth Memory (HBM), the specialized chips critical for powering AI data centers.', 'Micron reported a record revenue of $13.6 billion, surpassing the $13 billion consensus, while adjusted earnings of $4.78 per share blew past the $3.96 forecast.', 'The High-Bandwidth Gold Rush Secures 2026 Supply

The report effectively validates that the AI infrastructure buildout is accelerating rather than cooling.', 'Micron management confirmed that the company’s entire HBM supply for calendar 2026 is already sold out under fixed price and volume agreements.', 'CEO Sanjay Mehrotra has aggressively pulled forward the industry’s growth timeline, now forecasting that the HBM market will skyrocket to $100 billion by 2028, reaching that milestone two years earlier than previous projections.', 'This rapid expansion is driven by what Micron describes as a “pervasive step-up in demand” from well-capitalized hyperscalers who are locked into multi-year data center expansion plans.', 'An $18.7 Billion Forecast Crushes Overcapacity Fears

Micron’s forward-looking guidance has served as a massive “risk-remover” for semiconductor investors who feared a potential AI bubble.', 'For the current quarter, Micron is forecasting revenue of $18.7 billion, a staggering 30% higher than Wall Street’s $14.3 billion estimate.', 'Analysts are responding with aggressive price hikes; Morgan Stanley raised its target to $350 from $338, reiterating Micron as its “top pick in U.S. semis”.', 'The bank noted that as long as the “AI music plays,” Micron will continue to benefit from record-high margins, with gross margins projected to hit 67% in the coming quarter.', 'Multi-Gigawatt Demand Ignites the Broader Chip Sector

With its technology leadership in HBM4 and 1-gamma DRAM, Micron is now scaling its manufacturing capacity to meet a supply environment that remains “substantially short” of demand.', 'To support this, the company hiked its Fiscal 2026 capital expenditure plan to $20 billion, up from the previously estimated $18 billion.', 'The “Micron Effect” rippled through the sector on Thursday, lifting major peers such as Nvidia (NVDA), AMD (AMD), and Broadcom (AVGO).', 'Is Micron a Good Stock to Buy?', 'Analysts remain highly optimistic about Micron’s long-term prospects.', 'On TipRanks, MU stock has a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 27 Buys and three Hold ratings.', 'The average Micron price target of $311.68 implies 23% upside potential from current levels.', 'See more MU analyst ratings

label: NVDA
title: ‘It’s Hard to Justify,’ Says Top Investor About Nvidia Stock
article:
['Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) offers investors a seemingly straightforward proposition: pay a steep premium for its share price and the dominant AI chipmaker will keep delivering incredible top- and bottom-line growth.', 'That’s been the case for the past few years, and if one is to believe CEO Jensen Huang, the success story will keep rolling along through the end of the decade.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

On the one hand, it is hard to quibble with the company’s past performance, which manages to outpace the market’s sky-high expectations again and again.', 'The company’s third quarter fiscal 2026 numbers were only the latest iteration of this ongoing trend.', 'And yet, some storm clouds are appearing, as fears of an AI bubble are threatening to rain on Nvidia’s parade.', 'If hyperscaler capex starts to slow, so will Nvidia’s growth.', 'Even the distant rumblings of this possibility have been dragging down NVDA’s share price, which has fallen by 17% since reaching a new record high in late October.', 'However, despite the pullback, NVDA still trades at an elevated price-to-earnings ratio in the 40s.', 'That leads to the question: Is the premium that one must pay for NVDA still worth it?', 'Maybe not, according to top investor Daniel Sparks.', '“The setback may not be significant enough to fully price in some of the stock’s biggest risks,” warns the 5-star investor, who is among the top 1% of stock pros covered by TipRanks.', 'That doesn’t mean that Nvidia is anything other than a “great business,” Sparks hastens to add.', 'However, the investor further explains that NVDA’s high valuation can only make sense if revenues continue to expand rapidly and its gross margins remain extremely elevated.', 'Yet, both figures could fall regardless of how well Nvidia executes, which the investor readily admits it is likely to continue doing quite well.', '“The bigger risk is that the AI buildout takes a breather,” Sparks opined, noting that “the semiconductor industry has been cyclical for years.”

Other wild cards include increasing competition from hyperscalers, who are designing their own chips, as well as murky export rules.', 'Though Sparks isn’t ready just yet to declare that the AI boom is “fizzling out,” the investor is keeping a wary eye fixed to the horizon for this very real possibility.', '“The stock’s high valuation means investors likely won’t be very forgiving if the AI boom shows signs of slowing.', 'I do not believe the stock’s margin of safety at the moment is sufficient,” sums up Sparks.', '(To watch Daniel Sparks’ track record, click here)

That’s Sparks’ opinion – Wall Street is nowhere close to throwing in the towel.', 'With 39 Buys, 1 Hold, and 1 Sell, NVDA cruises to a Strong Buy consensus rating.', 'Its 12-month average price target of $258.97 implies potential upside of ~51%.', '(See NVDA stock forecast)

To find good ideas for stocks trading at attractive valuations, visit TipRanks’ Best Stocks to Buy, a tool that unites all of TipRanks’ equity insights.', 'Disclaimer: The opinions expressed in this article are solely those of the featured analyst.', 'The content is intended to be used for informational purposes only.', 'It is very important to do your own analysis before making any investment.', 'Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences: Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) offers investors a seemingly straightforward proposition: pay a steep premium for its share price and the dominant AI chipmaker will keep delivering incredible top- and bottom-line growth. That’s been the case for the past few years, and if one is to believe CEO Jensen Huang, the success story will keep rolling along through the end of the decade. And yet, some storm clouds are appearing, as fears of an AI bubble are threatening to rain on Nvidia’s parade. If hyperscaler capex starts to slow, so will Nvidia’s growth. That doesn’t mean that Nvidia is anything other than a “great business,” Sparks hastens to add. Yet, both figures could fall regardless of how well Nvidia executes, which the investor readily admits it is likely to continue doing quite well.

title: NVDA Stock Forecast — 3 Reasons Analysts See Nvidia Surging Over 50%
article:
['Nvidia (NVDA) has been at the forefront of the AI chip revolution and remains one of the most talked-about stocks among investors in 2025.', 'Looking ahead, top analysts see further upside, with the average price target implying over 50% gain, making NVDA stock an attractive opportunity.', 'Here are three key reasons behind this bullish outlook.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

1.', 'Nvidia’s GPU Advantage

Nvidia builds GPUs, powerful chips designed to handle heavy computing tasks.', 'While they were first used for gaming, GPUs are now critical for AI, scientific research, and data processing.', 'Bank of America’s five-star-rated analyst Vivek Arya noted that the biggest highlight for Nvidia is its confidence in future demand.', 'The company noted it has strong visibility into at least $500 billion in potential sales from its Blackwell and Rubin chips, along with networking products, through 2025 and 2026.', 'He added that today’s top AI models still use Nvidia’s Hopper chips, but the next generation is expected to shift to Blackwell, Nvidia’s new chip launching in early 2026.', 'Nvidia believes Blackwell could be 10 to 15 times more powerful, further widening its lead over competitors.', 'Arya has a Buy rating on NVDA stock with a price target of $275, predicting an upside of 55%.', '2.', 'Massive AI Spending Tailwind

Nvidia is a major winner of the global surge in AI spending.', 'As companies and governments pour billions into building AI data centers, Nvidia’s GPUs remain the default choice for training and running advanced AI models.', 'Nvidia is well-positioned to capture a large share of AI investment for years, supporting continued revenue and earnings growth.', 'Looking ahead, Nvidia expects global data-center capital spending to reach $3 trillion to $4 trillion by 2030, up from about $600 billion in 2025.', 'That implies a fivefold increase over the next five years, a trend that strongly supports Nvidia’s growth outlook.', 'Arya believes U.S. semiconductor companies, led by Nvidia, will benefit significantly from this unprecedented surge in AI infrastructure spending.', '3.', 'Easing China Worries

Nvidia could also gain from the U.S. government’s decision to allow sales of its advanced H200 chips to China, even though 25% of the revenue would go to the U.S. Treasury.', 'While approvals are not yet guaranteed, the move could mark an important step toward reopening the Chinese market, which once accounted for roughly 20%–25% of Nvidia’s data-center revenue.', 'Within this context, Wells Fargo’s top-rated analyst Aaron Rakers estimates the policy shift could add $25 billion to $30 billion in annual revenue.', 'Nvidia also appears to be preparing for this possibility, as the company may be reviewing its H200 production capacity.', 'Earlier this month, Rakers reiterated his Buy rating on NVDA stock, implying nearly 50% upside.', 'Is NVDA a Good Stock to Buy Now?', 'According to TipRanks, NVDA stock has a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 39 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell assigned in the last three months.', 'At $258.97, the Nvidia average share price target implies a 51.50% upside potential.', 'Overall, NVDA stock is up by over 30% year-to-date.', 'See more NVDA analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences:
Nvidia (NVDA) has been at the forefront of the AI chip revolution and remains one of the most talked-about stocks among investors in 2025. Nvidia’s GPU Advantage

Nvidia builds GPUs, powerful chips designed to handle heavy computing tasks. While they were first used for gaming, GPUs are now critical for AI, scientific research, and data processing. Bank of America’s five-star-rated analyst Vivek Arya noted that the biggest highlight for Nvidia is its confidence in future demand. He added that today’s top AI models still use Nvidia’s Hopper chips, but the next generation is expected to shift to Blackwell, Nvidia’s new chip launching in early 2026. Nvidia believes Blackwell could be 10 to 15 times more powerful, further widening its lead over competitors. Massive AI Spending Tailwind

Nvidia is a major winner of the global surge in AI spending. As companies and governments pour billions into building AI data centers, Nvidia’s GPUs remain the default choice for training and running advanced AI models. Nvidia is well-positioned to capture a large share of AI investment for years, supporting continued revenue and earnings growth. Looking ahead, Nvidia expects global data-center capital spending to reach $3 trillion to $4 trillion by 2030, up from about $600 billion in 2025. That implies a fivefold increase over the next five years, a trend that strongly supports Nvidia’s growth outlook. Arya believes U.S. semiconductor companies, led by Nvidia, will benefit significantly from this unprecedented surge in AI infrastructure spending. Easing China Worries

Nvidia could also gain from the U.S. government’s decision to allow sales of its advanced H200 chips to China, even though 25% of the revenue would go to the U.S. Treasury. While approvals are not yet guaranteed, the move could mark an important step toward reopening the Chinese market, which once accounted for roughly 20%–25% of Nvidia’s data-center revenue. Nvidia also appears to be preparing for this possibility, as the company may be reviewing its H200 production capacity. At $258.97, the Nvidia average share price target implies a 51.50% upside potential.

title: More Headaches for Nvidia (NVDA)? China Builds Prototype Machine for AI Chips
article:
['A team of Chinese scientists this year successfully built a prototype of the ultra‑advanced machine needed for making AI chips, according to Reuters.', 'Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium and Invest with Confidence

Unlock hedge-fund level data and powerful investing tools designed to help you make smarter, sharper decisions

Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis so your portfolio is always positioned for maximum potential

Although still a very early version, the prototype’s emergence is earlier than analysts anticipated.', 'It also comes as President Donald Trump’s administration continues to limit the export of high-end chips by American AI chip leader Nvidia (NVDA) to control China’s access to such technology and maintain AI dominance by the U.S.

How Did China Make the Prototype?', 'Sources told the outlet that the prototype machine — which is still extremely large and only in test mode — was made by a team of former engineers from Dutch semiconductor heavyweight ASML Holding (ASML).', 'They achieved this by procuring ASML’s older extreme ultraviolet lithography machines in secondary markets and taking them apart.', 'These machines are also called ‘EUVs’ and use extremely short-wavelength light to “print” the tiniest wiring patterns onto silicon wafers.', 'These wafers are used to produce the advanced chips that power complex AI workloads in data centers, defense systems, smartphones, and self-driving vehicles, among other applications.', 'The Chinese government has been seeking to develop the country’s own domestic AI chip sector and wean itself off dependence on technology from the U.S. and the West.', 'Chinese Rivals to Nvidia Continue to Emerge

On Wednesday, shares in Chinese chipmaker MetaX Integrated Circuits, which is seen as a strong rival to Nvidia (NVDA) in China, debuted with strong momentum on the Shanghai Stock Exchange.', 'Similarly, Chinese chipmaker Moore Threads’ initial public offering earlier this month was met with wide applause on the Chinese stock market.', 'However, technology-wise, analysts have observed that China still has a long way to go to catch up with the capacity of advanced AI chips produced in the U.S. and the West.', 'Is NVDA a Good Stock to Buy Now?', 'On Wall Street, Nvidia’s shares continue to carry a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 39 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell issued by 41 analysts over the past three months.', 'Moreover, the average NVDA price target of $258.97 implies more than 51% growth potential from current trading levels.', 'See more NVDA analyst ratings here.', 'Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue']
key_sentences:
A team of Chinese scientists this year successfully built a prototype of the ultra‑advanced machine needed for making AI chips, according to Reuters. It also comes as President Donald Trump’s administration continues to limit the export of high-end chips by American AI chip leader Nvidia (NVDA) to control China’s access to such technology and maintain AI dominance by the U.S.

How Did China Make the Prototype? These wafers are used to produce the advanced chips that power complex AI workloads in data centers, defense systems, smartphones, and self-driving vehicles, among other applications. Chinese Rivals to Nvidia Continue to Emerge

On Wednesday, shares in Chinese chipmaker MetaX Integrated Circuits, which is seen as a strong rival to Nvidia (NVDA) in China, debuted with strong momentum on the Shanghai Stock Exchange. However, technology-wise, analysts have observed that China still has a long way to go to catch up with the capacity of advanced AI chips produced in the U.S. and the West. On Wall Street, Nvidia’s shares continue to carry a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 39 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell issued by 41 analysts over the past three months.
